intro: Braya monantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf winterfat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has basal leaves that are narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Braya monantha plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects and animals.
